Key Match Events: Jaren Jackson Jr. poured in 38 points to lead the Memphis Grizzlies to a 117-112 win over the host Phoenix Suns.
Desmond Bane added 31 points to help the Grizzlies win.
Kevin Durant bundled 29 points, 10 rebounds, and six assists to lead the Suns, but they lost Bradley Beal after the first quarter due to a hip contusion.
The Grizzlies opened up a 14-point halftime advantage and held on after Phoenix closed within a point in the fourth quarter.
Jaren Jackson Jr. was active early, scoring 14 of the Grizzlies' first 20 points, and finished the first quarter with 19 points, helping the visitors stake a 36-26 lead.
Bane stepped up and ripped the momentum back Memphis' way, pouring in 13 second-quarter points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bradley Beal was hurt when he landed awkwardly after being fouled by Jackson with 4:40 left in the opening frame.
Devin Booker managed 16 points on just 4-of-20 shooting after missing the Suns' last five games with a groin strain.
The Grizzlies finished the first half on a 19-10 run and carried a 69-55 lead into the break.
Others: The Suns rallied in the third quarter by going inside to Mason Plumlee, who threw down four dunks to help bring Phoenix within 74-71.
Luke Kennard supplied 17 points and seven rebounds off the bench for Memphis, while John Konchar pulled down 12 rebounds to go with his seven points.
